dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4874 IH: Technical Assistance for Health Grants Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Kildee introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To provide for technical assistance under the health profession opportunity grant program under section 2008 of the Social Security Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Technical Assistance for Health Grants Act.

subsection.text: Section 2008 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1397) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(4), by striking subparagraph (D); and
by redesignating subsections (c) and (d) as subsections (d) and (e) and inserting after subsection (b) the following:
The Secretary shall provide technical assistance—

subparagraph.text: to assist eligible entities in applying for grants under this section;
that is tailored to meet the needs of grantees at each stage of the administration of projects for which grants are made under this section;
that is tailored to meet the specific needs of Indian tribes, tribal organizations, and tribal colleges and universities;
that is tailored to meet the specific needs of the territories;
that is tailored to meet the specific needs of eligible entities in carrying out demonstration projects for which a grant is made under this section; and
to facilitate the exchange of information among eligible entities regarding best practices and promising practices used in the projects.

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall hold peer technical assistance conferences for entities to which a grant is made under this section.

During each Congress, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Finance of the Senate a report on the nature of any technical assistance provided to grantees under this section.

subsection.text: Section 2008(c)(1) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1397(c)(1)) is amended by inserting , and to carry out subsection (c) $15,000,000 for fiscal year 2024 before the period.

section.text: The amendments made by this Act shall take effect on October 1, 2023.
